Key Match Events: Taylor Ward put the Angels up 1-0 with a solo home run in the bottom of the first
Luke Raley tied the game 1-1 in the top of the second with a solo home run
Josh Rojas scored on an RBI sacrifice fly from Victor Robles to give the Mariners the lead
Anthony Rendon had the go-ahead hit in the bottom of the fifth with a two-RBI single
Pre-Game Insights: It might be bad luck or simply a bad matchup but the Los Angeles Angels seemed to have the Seattle Mariners' number all season
Post-Match Reflections: Mariners manager Dan Wilson said in a postgame interview Sunday, 'Tough series here in Anaheim. Came in here (after) winning a couple series. And you're always in for some tough ballgames here. Two one-run games after the first game of the series. So some tough baseball. Thought the guys battled all the way through today. Tough one to lose this afternoon'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The loss dropped Seattle to 69-68 and moved them six games behind the Houston Astros for first place in the American League West
Houston swept the Kansas City Royals in four games to take its biggest lead of the year so far in the division
